channel.title: Command help

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @Rustyoid Rustyoid
item.description:
@Rustyoid wrote:

[quote=“jamessemple, post:3, topic:309801”]generally for java to do the opposite of things you code it to do you add symbols corresponding to the written command. in your case i’d try writing it like this:

!writeLog(p.playerName, "bans");

add the ! in front of original code to reverse the code
hope this helped

—James—[/quote]

EDIT: didnt work, im trying the first post now

Read full topic

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

generally for java to do the opposite of things you code it to do you add symbols corresponding to the written command. in your case i’d try writing it like this:

!writeLog(p.playerName, "bans");

add the ! in front of original code to reverse the code
hope this helped

—James—

Read full topic

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

Here is the code I used to use.

Add this in client class:

[code]
public void unmuteuser(String user) {
String directory = “…/Data/Mutes.txt”; //directory to ban file.
String lines[] = new String[1000]; //allows upto 1000 bans
String xkine = new String();
int on = 0;
BufferedWriter bw = null;

			try {
				
				sM(user+ " Has been unmuted!");
				yell("["+playerName+"] - @red@"+user+"@bla@ has been @gre@unmuted!");
				BufferedReader dataStream = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(directory));
				while ((xkine = dataStream.readLine()) != null) {
					if(xkine.equalsIgnoreCase(user)) {

					} else
					if(!xkine.equalsIgnoreCase(user)) {
						lines[on] = xkine;
						on++;
					}
				}

			} catch(Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}

			try {
				bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(directory, false));
				bw.write(""); //clearing file
				bw.flush();
				bw.close();
			} catch(Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}

			try {
				bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(directory, true));
				for(int a = 0; a < lines.length; a++) {
					if(lines[a] != null) {
						bw.write(lines[a]);
						bw.newLine();
						bw.flush();
					}
				}
				bw.close();

			} catch(Exception e) {
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
		}[/code]

Then in your commands file, add this;

[code] if (command.startsWith(“unmute”) && c.playerRights >= 1) {
for(int i = 0; i < GameEngine.playerHandler.players.length; i++){
if(GameEngine.playerHandler.players[i] != null){
if(command.substring(7).equalsIgnoreCase(GameEngine.playerHandler.players[i].playerName)){
Client plr = null;
plr = (Client) GameEngine.playerHandler.players[i];
String name = command.substring(7);

						c.unmuteuser(name);
						plr.disconnected = true; //Kicks the player
					}
				}
			}
		}[/code]

~ Jayden

Read full topic

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @Rustyoid Rustyoid
item.description:
@Rustyoid wrote:

Ok, so i have a working ban and mute command, and I’m trying to make an unban and unmute but I’m not quite sure what to do.

Heres what i have:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“unbanuser”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(8);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

		writeLog(p.playerName, "bans");
		p.disconnected = true;
		sM("You have unbanned "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }[/code]

[code] if (command.startsWith(“unmute”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                    p.muted = true;
		writeLog(p.playerName, "mutes");
		sM("You have unmuted "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to mute..");
            }
        }[/code]

What should I use to make it remove from the logs? I’ve tried replacing writeLog(p.pl... with deleteLog(p.pl... removeLog(p.pl... and unwriteLog(p.pl... but it doesn’t work.

Read full topic
